page.title: 13Rolvenden's Motor Museum
page.content: In l960 Christopher Booth, then aged 16, drove his first Morgan 3-wheeler car. So began a hobby which grew until he now has probably the best collection of these cars in the world. Passing tourists and enthusiasts from many countries come to visit the{Motor {Museum}which he has built behind his antique shop in the High Street. As well as the 10 Morgan cars, most of which he drives regularly, he has other motor vehicles, motorcycles, bicycles and toy cars on display. The museum was opened in 1972 and Mr Booth is still busy renovating Morgan cars. He found one car in the attic of a London house, with the engine and chassis in the spare bedroom! Mr Booth has to build many of the spare parts himself. In one case he had to build a replica body for one car which had been left out for nearly 40 years.
